colorLib.webServices
Class Kuler

java.lang.Object
  colorLib.webServices.WebService
      colorLib.webServices.Kuler

public class Kuler
extends WebService

The Kuler object is a container to query the Adobe Kuler service and get the response as a KulerTheme object. Take a look at the Kuler API to see the possibilities of the Kuler service.
A Kuler palette contains 5 colors per theme. The default number of themes returned per query is 20, but you can increase the count up 100. To query more than 100 themes, you have to increase the startIndex. A query with maxItems=100 and startIndex=2 will return 100 themes starting at 200.

Author:
Andreas Köberle, Jan Vantomme

public void setKey(java.lang.String key)

setDebugMode

public void setDebugMode(boolean debug)
Sets the debug mode. Default is true. If you set this to false, nothing will be printed to the Processing console.

Parameters:
debug -

getHighestRated

public KulerTheme[] getHighestRated()
Get the highest rated colors as an array of KulerThemes. As it isn't necessary to load an xml every time you start your sketch you can save it by using the filename parameter. Once a result is saved it will be used every time you use the same filename parameter

Returns:
KulerTheme[], an array of all themes which match the query

getHighestRated

public KulerTheme[] getHighestRated(java.lang.String filename)
Parameters:
filename - Filename to save the result xml, respectively load the xml if it still exists

getPopular

public KulerTheme[] getPopular(java.lang.String filename)
Get the most popular colors for the specified number of days (default is 30 days) as an array of KulerThemes. As it isn't necessary to load an xml every time you start your sketch you can save it by using the filename parameter. Once a result is saved it will be used every time you use the same filename parameter

Overrides:

Returns:
KulerTheme[], an array of all themes which match the query

search

public KulerTheme[] search(java.lang.String searchQuery)
Use your own query string or creates one by a given filter name and a query. Possible filters are "themeID", "userID", "email", "tag", "hex" and "title". Take a look at the API to see the possibilities of the kuler service.
The result is an array of KulerThemes. As it isn't necessary to load an xml every time you start your sketch you can save it by using the filename parameter. Once a result is saved it will be used every time you use the same filename parameter

Parameters:
searchQuery - String: your query
Returns:
KulerTheme[], an array of all themes which match the query

search

public KulerTheme[] search(java.lang.String searchQuery,
                           java.lang.String filter)
Parameters:
searchQuery - String: query that is use with a searchFilter
filter - String: one of the following filters: "themeID", "userID", "email", "tag", "hex" and "title"

filename - Filename to save the result xml, respectively load the xml if it still exists

setserverPage

public void setserverPage(java.lang.String serverPath,
                          java.lang.String pageType)
As you can't connect to the Kuler service directly if you run your sketch as an Applet, you can set a path to a php/cfm/... script. You can query the Kuler service from that page and send the response XML to the Applet.

Parameters:
serverPath -
pageType -
